intro: Dialium madagascariense subsp. occidentale, commonly known as the western African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers followed by woody, elongated fruits containing edible seeds. It is often cultivated for its timber, which is valued for its durability and fine grain. The species also has traditional uses in local medicine and as a source of food.
